newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian 3.Maj shipyard gets new German orders.
newsitem.headline: Croatian 3.Maj shipyard gets new German orders.

text.p: State-owned shipyard 3.Maj said on Tuesday that it secured fixed orders to build two oil and chemical tankers for German clients, with another two tankers under option.
It said its director signed agreements for 13,000-tonne tankers for delivery in 1999 with shippers Erste and Zweite Buettner Schiffahrtgesellschaft GmbH & Co in Hamburg today.
These bring 3.Maj's orderbook to seven vessels, all of them for foreign buyers, the shipyard said in a statement faxed to Reuters. It did not mention the value of the new deals.
The shipyard, which is being overhauled under a government programme, hopes Monaco-based Scorpio Ship Management may boost its order to four tankers in July from two it contracted earlier this year.
"This gives us ground to expect favourable results... Also, these construction jobs ensure a continued restructuring of the 3.Maj business system," it said.
